page.title: 07Richmond's nature reserve
page.content: The reserve is largely 2 to 8m deep around the edges of the school grounds. We started our reserve in 1980. With cash raised through raffle ticket sales we bought over 600 "Whips" (very small trees).These were planted in carefully planned areas by the children.The area was surrounded by small wooden stakes connected with string.The area was then left to itself. The reserve has been greatly extended since its initial planting. Several wild flower gardens have been created and a pond which supports a substantial frog and newt population.A large part of the reserve is enclosed by turf barrows which landscape and protect the area. Already,weasels, hedgehogs,kestrel,owls and grass snakes have been seen.We hope that the site is protected in the long term and will continue to thrive.
